div.p: Giles wishes me to give my name to great salt lake & south Mount but adopt instead Amadeus & Olga Please keep the two latter

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Baron Von Mueller
On 21 January 1873 the Deputy Surveyor General, Arthur Cooper, wrote to the Chief Secretary, Henry Ayres: 'Mr Giles map and 2nd vol of journal. Returned to the Secy for […]. The general results of Mr Giles' exploration have been given to Mr Gosse as fully as a Telegram of 160 words would permit. He is also informed of Baron Von Müeller's suggestion that the north slope of the MacDonnell Ranges will be interesting to explore.' (CSO 103/72). On 24 January 1873 get name replied to [Secretary for …]: 'It is respectfully suggested that in return for Baron von Mueller's ready courtesy in placing these journals & plans in the hands of the Govt that the latter might be photolithographed in this Office and copies supplied to the Baron and Mr Giles.' This suggestion was approved by JR, CCS the same day. Both minutes were returned to the Surveyor General on 25 January 1873.
